verdict.summary: Goroutines are not being cleaned up, usually from missing context cancellation or blocked channel operations.

dead_ends.action: Increase GOMAXPROCS to handle more goroutines
dead_ends.why_fails: GOMAXPROCS controls OS thread count, not goroutine count; leaked goroutines still consume memory
Goexit only terminates the calling goroutine; cannot kill other goroutines externally

workarounds.action: Add select with context.Done() to every goroutine for cancellation
Use errgroup for managing goroutine lifecycles
Monitor goroutine count with runtime.NumGoroutine() in tests

preceded_by.condition: Blocked channel operations prevent goroutine exit
